chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W. Moses was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with HNF (dob 2/19/98) or her residence, or any child under 18yrs of age, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Participate and follow sex offender treatment and comply with sex offender registry.  Participate and follow recommendations of mental health evaluation.  Participate in the creation of a realistic case plan and any programming related to the associated goals and identified criminogenic needs.  Make payments for court obligations and supervision fees.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 4 years WSP; 2 yrs Initial followed by 2 yrs ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  DE is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP forthwith; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  See conditions,  Credit for 143 days.  DE is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 8/14/15 at 11:30 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Mattew Perz.  Clerk: PT
Atty Perz states he needs additional time to follow up on mental health records and requests an adjournment; no objection by the State. FPT adj. to 6/18/15 at 9:00 AM.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: File sent to Br 3 for subst.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Perz. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-28-15 @ 9:30am. Bond continued.
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Perz. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.
